t: O*pn God, the nations have invaded your inheritance; they*ld have defiled your holy temple, they*ld have reduced Jerusalem to rubble.
They*ln have left the dead bodies of your servants as*ld food for the birds of the sky, the*ld flesh of your own people for the animals of the wild.
They*ln have poured out blood like water all*ld around Jerusalem, and*ld there is no one to bury the dead.
We*ln are objects of contempt to our neighbors, of*ld scorn and derision to those around us.
How*pn long, Lord?*s Will you be angry forever? How*ld long will your jealousy burn like fire?
Pour*ln out your wrath on the nations that*ld do not acknowledge you, on*ln the kingdoms that*ld do not call on your name;
for*ln they have devoured Jacob and*ld devastated his homeland.
Do*pn not hold against us the sins of past generations; may*ld your mercy come quickly to meet us, for*ld we are in desperate need.
Help*ln us, God our Savior, for*ld the glory of your name; deliver*ln us and forgive our sins for*ld your name’s sake.
Why*ln should the nations say, “Where*ld is their God?” Before*pn our eyes, make known among the nations that*ld you avenge the outpoured blood of your servants.
May*ln the groans of the prisoners come before you; with*ld your strong arm preserve those condemned to die.
Pay*ln back into the laps of our neighbors seven times the*ld contempt they have hurled at you, Lord.
Then*ln we your people, the sheep of your pasture, will*ld praise you forever; from*ln generation to generation we*ld will proclaim your praise.
